item.title: Optimization Techniques in Mathematics
item.description: Definition The problem of finding $x^{ \ast } = \argmin_{x} f(x)$ that makes the function value of function $f : \mathbb{R}^{n} \to \mathbb{R}$ minimum is known as the Optimization Problem, and the algorithm to solve this problem is called an Optimization Technique. The given function $f$ in the optimization problem is specifically referred to as the Objective Function. $x^{ \ast }$ is called the Global Optimizer if for all $x$,
